question: Question_01_(f)
statement:
Find the \emph{y}-coordinate of the centroid of the region bounded by
the curves $y = 1$ , $y = -e^{x}$, $x=0$ and $x=1$. You may use the fact
that the area of this region equals \emph{e}.
sols:
Let $f(x) = 1$ and $g(x) = -e^{x}$. Notice that between \emph{0} and
\emph{1}, we have that $g(x) \leq f(x)$ and so we have

\begin{align*}
\bar{y} &= \frac{1}{2A}\int_{0}^{1}(f(x)^{2} - g(x)^{2})\, dx\\
&= \frac{1}{2e}\int_{0}^{1}(1^{2} - (-e^{x})^{2})\, dx\\
&= \frac{1}{2e}\int_{0}^{1}(1 - e^{2x})\, dx\\
&= \frac{1}{2e}\left. \left(x - \frac{e^{2x}}{2}\right) \right|_{0}^{1}\\
&= \frac{1}{2e}\left( \left(1 - \frac{e^{2(1)}}{2}\right) - \left(0 - \frac{e^{2(0)}}{2}\right)  \right)\\
&= \frac{1}{2e}\left( 1 - \frac{e^{2}}{2} + \frac{1}{2}\right) \\
&= \frac{1}{2e}\left( \frac{3}{2} - \frac{e^{2}}{2} \right)\\
&= \frac{3-e^{2}}{4e}\end{align*}

completing the question.
